intro: Tapirira bethanniana, commonly known as the Brazilian senna, is a species of flowering plant in the Fabaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers, which are typical of the legume family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Tapirira bethanniana is also valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine.
